radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate bilateral pleural effusions, without evidence of pulmonary embolism.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral pleural effusions, hypodense lesions in the liver, and minimal ascites.
Dramatic increase in the left perinephric collection of fluid and larger left pleural effusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Fluid around the left kidney rapidly reaccumulated and required aspiration.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodule (5 mm in diameter) in the upper lobe of the left lung, hepatic hemangiomas, a large left perinephric collection of fluid with mass effect on the left renal vessels, a small right perinephric collection of fluid, and ascites.
Resolution of the left perinephric fluid; minimal fluid surrounds the right kidney.
Dramatic increase in ascites throughout the peritoneum.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: 4 liters of fluid drained with the composition identical to that seen in the past.
